name: Exoplanet Transit Method
explanation: Transit method detects exoplanets when they pass in front of star, causing small brightness dip. Fractional brightness decrease equals (R_p/R_⋆)². Used by Kepler and TESS missions to find thousands of exoplanets. Provides planet radius and orbital period. Combined with Doppler shift, gives planet mass and density.

examples.problem: Star dims by 1% during transit. Star radius is 1 solar radius. What is planet radius?
Why is transit method so successful?
examples.solution: Can detect many planets simultaneously and works for distant stars
steps: Works for planets with edge-on orbits

proof: ΔF/F = (R_p/R_⋆)². When planet transits, blocks area πR_p² of star with area πR_⋆². Fractional decrease in flux equals fractional decrease in area: ΔF/F = (πR_p²)/(πR_⋆²) = (R_p/R_⋆)². Larger planets cause bigger dips.
